revised_title: Revisiting the Discrepancy in Friction Factor Ratio in Laminar Flow in Coils
tldr: The authors investigate the origins of the discrepancy between the friction factor ratio in laminar flow in coiled tubes using the extended Stokes series method and other theoretical, experimental, and numerical techniques. They re-examine the problem in light of new numerical evidence and suggest that the cause of the discrepancy lies in the use of only the first 12 terms in the Stokes series. The authors' numerical calculations show that the friction factor ratio varies as the square root of the Dean number at high Dean numbers, resolving the paradox.
